problem.p:
A system of effective mass m has a potential energy given by
\(U(x)=U_0 \bigg( -2\Big(\displaystyle\frac{x}{x_0}\Big)^2+\Big(\displaystyle\frac{x}{x_0}\Big)^4\bigg) \)
where \(U_0\) and \(x_0\) are positive constants and \(U(0)=0\)
Part 1. The particle is in stable equilibrium at the point(s): 0 \(\pm x_0\) \( \frac{x_0}{2} \)

Part 2. If the particle is given a small displacement from a stable equilibrium point, the angular frequency of small oscillation is :
\(\displaystyle\sqrt{\frac{U_0}{m x_0^2}}\) \(\displaystyle\sqrt{\frac{8 U_0}{m x_0^2}}\) \(\displaystyle\sqrt{\frac{U_0}{8 m x_0^2}}\) \(\displaystyle\sqrt{\frac{U_0}{m x_0}}\) \(\displaystyle\sqrt{\frac{4 U_0}{m x_0^2}}\)
